intro: Decachaeta, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Decachaeta is often found in moist, disturbed soils in tropical and subtropical regions. It is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environments.
